#summary Advanced command line option details for Hammer

= Command line options =

Omaha uses Google's open-sourced [http://code.google.com/p/swtoolkit/ Software Construction Toolkit] (codename: Hammer) to build. This page covers some of the command line options that may be useful for building.

||hammer||Default build (debug, using precompiled headers, signed with the test cert)||
||hammer MODE=dbg-win||Do a Debug build||
||hammer MODE=opt-win||Do an Optimized build||
||hammer MODE=all||Do both a debug & an optimized build||
||hammer --clean||Clean intermediate files||
||hammer --verbose||Verbose output||
||hammer --use_precompiled_headers||Enable precompiled header support (default)||
||hammer --no-use_precompiled_headers||Disable precompiled header support||
||hammer --min||Minimum build||
||hammer --all||Complete build (all subdirs)||
||*code* *signing* *options*||

Command line options can be combined, so the command `hammer MODE=opt-win --min --verbose` will do a minimum optimized build, producing verbose output.
